CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The best power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 6.33% was obtained from PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 with [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) due to the improved light absorption and thus a short - circuit current density ( J SC ) higher than 16 mA / cm^2.

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25
2. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM )

Both PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 and PC71BM are material names mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25
2. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM )

These are the only entities in the paragraph that can be clearly identified as material names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The best power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 6.33% was obtained from PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 with [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) due to the improved light absorption and thus a short - circuit current density ( J SC ) higher than 16 mA / cm^2.

Let's think step by step.

1. Best power conversion efficiency (PCE) - A quantitative property representing the maximum power that can be converted from an input electrical energy source to an output electrical energy source. In this context, it is the maximum efficiency obtained from PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 with PC71BM.
2. 6.33% - A specific value of the PCE property.
3. PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 - A specific material or device that has a PCE of 6.33%.
4. [6,6]-phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) - A specific material or substance that contributes to the improved light absorption and higher short-circuit current density (J SC) in PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25.
5. Improved light absorption - A qualitative property describing the enhanced ability of PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 to absorb light due to the presence of PC71BM.
6. Higher short-circuit current density (J SC) - A quantitative property representing the maximum current that can flow through a photovoltaic device under short-circuit conditions. In this context, it is higher than 16 mA / cm^2.
7. 16 mA / cm^2 - A specific value of the short-circuit current density (J SC) property.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. Best power conversion efficiency (PCE) - A quantitative property of PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 with a value of 6.33%.
2. Higher short-circuit current density (J SC) - A quantitative property of PBDTT-DPP75-TPD25 with a value greater than 16 mA / cm^2.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value                                   |
|----------------------------------------------|
| Best power conversion efficiency (PCE) of 6.33%  |
| Higher short-circuit current density (J SC) > 16 mA / cm^2 |
